member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwareness
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a thread, process, or window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwareness.Invalid
member.summary: Invalid DPI awareness. This is an invalid DPI awareness value.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwareness.Unaware
member.summary: This process does not scale for DPI changes and is always assumed to have a scale factor of 100% (96 DPI). It will be automatically scaled by the system on any other DPI setting.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwareness.SystemAware
member.summary: This process does not scale for DPI changes. It will query for the DPI once and use that value for the lifetime of the process. If the DPI changes, the process will not adjust to the new DPI value. It will be automatically scaled up or down by the system when the DPI changes from the system value.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwareness.PerMonitorAware
member.summary: This process checks for the DPI when it is created and adjusts the scale factor whenever the DPI changes. These processes are not automatically scaled by the system.

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext
member.summary: Identifies the awareness context for a window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext.Unaware
member.summary: This window does not scale for DPI changes and is always assumed to have a scale factor of 100% (96 DPI). It will be automatically scaled by the system on any other DPI setting.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext.SystemAware
member.summary: This window does not scale for DPI changes. It will query for the DPI once and use that value for the lifetime of the process. If the DPI changes, the process will not adjust to the new DPI value. It will be automatically scaled up or down by the system when the DPI changes from the system value.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext.PerMonitorAware
member.summary: This window checks for the DPI when it is created and adjusts the scale factor whenever the DPI changes. These processes are not automatically scaled by the system.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext.PerMonitorAwareV2
member.summary: An advancement over the original per-monitor DPI awareness mode, which enables applications to access new DPI-related scaling behaviors on a per top-level window basis. Per Monitor v2 was made available in the Creators Update of Windows 10, and is not available on earlier versions of the operating system.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.DpiAwarenessContext.UnawareGdiScaled
member.summary: DPI unaware with improved quality of GDI-based content. This mode behaves similarly to DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_UNAWARE, but also enables the system to automatically improve the rendering quality of text and other GDI-based primitives when the window is displayed on a high-DPI monitor.

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle
member.summary: Extended Window Styles

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.AcceptFiles
member.summary: The window accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.AppWindow
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.ClientEdge
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Composited
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. For more information, see Remarks. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.ContextHelp
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.ControlParent
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.DlgModalFrame
member.summary: The window has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Layered
member.summary: The window is a layered window. This style cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.LayoutRtl
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Left
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.LeftScrollbar
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.LtrReading
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.MdiChild
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.NoActivate
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.NoInheritLayout
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.NoParentNotify
member.summary: The child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.NoRedirectionBitmap
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.OverlappedWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.PaletteWindow
member.summary: The window is palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Right
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.RightScrollbar
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.RtlReading
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.StaticEdge
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.ToolWindow
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Topmost
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.Transparent
member.summary: The window should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ExtendedWindowStyle.WindowEdge
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.LayeredWindowAttributes
member.summary: Layered Window Attributes

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.LayeredWindowAttributes.None
member.summary: The none

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.LayeredWindowAttributes.ColorKey
member.summary: The color key

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.LayeredWindowAttributes.Alpha
member.summary: The alpha

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.LayeredWindowAttributes.Opaque
member.summary: The opaque

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand
member.summary: Controls how the window is to be shown.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowMinNoActivate
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.ShowNormal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags
member.summary: SetWindowPos flags

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.AsyncWindowPos
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.DeferErase
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.DrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.FrameChanged
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.HideWindow
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoActivate
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoCopyBits
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoMove
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoOwnerZOrder
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoRedraw
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoReposition
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoSendChanging
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoSize
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.NoZOrder
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.SwpFlags.ShowWindow
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: T:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle
member.summary: Window Styles

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Border
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Caption
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the Border style).

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Child
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the Popup style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.ChildWindow
member.summary: Same as the Child style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.ClipChildren
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.ClipSiblings
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the ClipSiblings style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If ClipSiblings is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Disabled
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.DlgFrame
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Group
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the Group style. The first control in each group usually has the Tabstop style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.HScroll
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Iconic
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the Minimize style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Maximize
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.MaximizeBox
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The SysMenu style must also be specified.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Minimize
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the Iconic style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.MinimizeBox
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The SysMenu style must also be specified.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Overlapped
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.OverlappedWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the TiledWindow style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Popup
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the Child style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.PopupWindow
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The Caption and PopupWindow styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Sizebox
member.summary: he window has a sizing border. Same as the ThickFrame style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.SysMenu
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The Caption style must also be specified.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Tabstop
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the Tabstop style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.ThickFrame
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the Sizebox style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Tiled
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the Overlapped style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.TiledWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the OverlappedWindow style.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.Visible
member.summary: The window is initially visible.

member.name: F:GameOverlay.PInvoke.WindowStyle.VScroll
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.
